article_text:
DETROIT—This city submitted its financial restructuring plan to federal court Friday, a move likely to set off a new round of jockeying among creditors asked to take a haircut in the nation's largest municipal bankruptcy.

The plan seeks to restructure an estimated $18 billion in long-term obligations by paying secured creditors in full, paying pension funds a reduced amount, and giving other unsecured creditors just a fraction—about...

twitter.description: Detroit's emergency manager filed a plan Friday to restructure the city's $18 billion debt in the largest municipal bankruptcy in U.S. history.
twitter.creator: @matthewsdolan

image.alt: Detroit files debt-cutting plan in nation's largest municipal bankruptcy

twitter.title: Detroit Files Debt-Cutting Plan
